scan_metadata.scan_theme: AI monetization reality: Is AI actually making money? Economic/industrial impact, bubble vs innovation evidence

items.title: The Innovation Tax: Generative AI Adoption, Productivity Paradox, and Systemic Risk in the U.S. Banking Sector
items.title_ko: 혁신세(Innovation Tax): 미국 은행 부문의 생성형 AI 도입, 생산성 역설, 시스템 리스크

content.abstract: 809 US financial institutions (2018-2025), SEC 10-Q filings + Fed regulatory data. ChatGPT launch as exogenous shock for causal inference. AI-adopting banks suffer 428bp ROE and 46bp ROA decline = Innovation Tax. Smaller banks hit 4x harder (-517bp vs -129bp). Algorithmic coupling creates systemic risk amplification.

items.title: Beyond the Commit: Developer Perspectives on Productivity with AI Coding Assistants
items.title_ko: 커밋 너머: AI 코딩 어시스턴트에 대한 개발자 생산성 관점

content.abstract: BNY Mellon mixed-method study: 2,989 developer survey + 11 interviews. Multifaceted productivity measurement needed. Conflicting views on tool usefulness. 6 productivity dimensions identified. Long-term metrics (expertise, ownership) undervalued in prior research.

items.title: AI IDEs or Autonomous Agents? Measuring the Impact of Coding Agents on Software Development
items.title_ko: AI IDE인가 자율 에이전트인가? 코딩 에이전트의 소프트웨어 개발 영향 측정

content.abstract: Longitudinal causal study of LLM coding agents on OSS repos. Agents deliver large front-loaded velocity gains only as first AI tool. Static analysis warnings +18%, cognitive complexity +39% = agent-induced technical debt. Diminishing returns when combining multiple AI tools.

items.title: The Price of Progress: Algorithmic Efficiency and the Falling Cost of AI Inference
items.title_ko: 진보의 가격: 알고리즘 효율성과 AI 추론 비용의 하락

content.abstract: Benchmark performance costs falling 5-10x per year for frontier models across knowledge, reasoning, math, and software engineering. After controlling for hardware improvements, pure algorithmic efficiency gains ~3x annually. Recommends incorporating benchmark costs in AI evaluations.

items.title: The AI Scaling Wall of Diminishing Returns: Of LLMs, Electric Dogs, and General Relativity
items.title_ko: AI 스케일링의 수확체감 벽: LLM, 전기 개, 일반상대성이론

content.abstract: LLMs face critical scaling bottleneck: compute grows 10-100x while accuracy barely moves. Quantifies the slowdown. Next leap will come from smarter, more efficient approaches rather than bigger models.

LLMs in oligopolistic Cournot markets. LLMs grasp complex market dynamics but engage in sustained tacit collusion, driving prices up to 200% above Nash equilibrium. Regulating dominant agents via best-response enforcement disrupts collusion and restores competitive pricing.

items.title: Algorithmic Collusion by Large Language Models

content.abstract: LLM pricing agents quickly and autonomously reach supracompetitive prices and profits in oligopoly settings. Minor prompt variations significantly affect pricing behavior. Price-war concerns as key factor. Extends to auction contexts. Raises regulatory challenges for AI pricing systems.

items.title: Resolving the automation paradox: falling labor share, rising wages
items.title_ko: 자동화 역설의 해결: 노동분배율은 하락해도 임금은 상승한다

content.abstract: Challenges conventional concerns about AI reducing wages. Declining labor share is more likely to raise wages in competitive economies. 12 industrialized nations analysis: all currently above wage-maximizing labor share level. Falling labor share contributed ~16% of US real wage growth 1954-2019.

items.title: A Cost-Benefit Analysis of On-Premise Large Language Model Deployment: Breaking Even with Commercial LLM Services
items.title_ko: 온프레미스 LLM 배포의 비용-편익 분석: 상용 LLM 서비스와의 손익분기점

content.abstract: Cost-benefit framework for cloud vs on-premise LLM deployment. Evaluates Qwen, Llama, Mistral. Mid-scale open-source models (120B) run on 2x A100 ($30k) with <10% accuracy loss. Derives breakeven points based on usage volume and performance requirements.

items.title: Engineering AI Agents for Clinical Workflows: A Case Study in Architecture, MLOps, and Governance
items.title_ko: 임상 워크플로우를 위한 AI 에이전트 엔지니어링: 아키텍처, MLOps, 거버넌스 사례 연구

content.abstract: Production-grade healthcare AI platform 'Maria'. Four engineering pillars for trustworthy clinical AI: Clean Architecture, event-driven architecture, autonomous agents with individual MLOps lifecycles, human-in-the-loop governance. Reference architecture for high-stakes domain AI deployment.

Existing scaling laws fail to account for inference costs. Same-size models vary up to 3.5x in latency. Modified Chinchilla scaling laws for joint optimization of parameters, training tokens, and architecture. 63 models trained. Morph-1B: 1.8x inference latency improvement while maintaining accuracy.

items.title: DeepSeek-R1: Incentivizing Reasoning Capability in LLMs via Reinforcement Learning
items.title_ko: DeepSeek-R1: 강화학습을 통한 LLM 추론 능력 촉진

content.abstract: Pure RL incentivizes reasoning in LLMs. Emergent self-reflection, verification, dynamic strategy adaptation. Distilled R1-7B outperforms GPT-4o. R1-32B/70B surpass o1-mini on most benchmarks. Training cost $5.6M (2.664M H800 GPU hours) for frontier-level performance.
